PPG Architectural Coatings Reno Distribution Center, Nevada

RMP Executive Summary Dated 9/11/2018



I. Accidental Release Prevention & Emergency Response Policies

The PPG Reno Distribution Center complies with applicable Nevada and US EPA regulations, Department of Transportation and OSHA requirements for the storage, handling, and shipping of flammable aerosol containers. PPG also follows applicable Coating Care (registered service trademark) Codes of Management Practices including Community Awareness code of Management Practices, and PPG's own Community Awareness and Emergency Response (CAER) Policy to assure emergency preparedness and foster community right-to-know. PPG Reno Distribution Center also trains employees in accident prevention, hazard communication, emergency response, safe material handling procedures and fork truck driving safety. All of these activities form an integral part of PPG's overall Environmental, Health and Safety policy to distribute products in a responsible manner that protects employees, neighbors, customers and the environment. 



II. Regulated Substance Handled on Site.

The PPG Reno Distribution Center is part of the Architectural Coatings business unit. The facility stores paint related products in aerosol containers, of various forms, for distribution to dealers of PPG owned stores and home centers throughout the United States. Some of the aerosols contain propane and butane, which are used as propellants. These two materials are regulated as flammable substances under the EPA RMP regulations. 



III. Worst-Case Scenario:

Worst-case analysis consisted of a 1lb release resulting in a vapor cloud of 0.01 miles (53ft). The flammable aerosols are stored within the facility in a designated storage area; therefore the vapor cloud would be contained within the facility walls. An alternative scenario would involve an accidental release at a dock during loading or unloading of product, in which the vapor cloud explosion would not re

ach any of the closest public receptors. 



IV. General Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:

The Reno Distribution Center complies with OSHA PSM and EPA RMP regulations for the safe storage of flammable aerosols. Under the RMP regulations the Reno Distribution Center facility's aerosol storage process is classified as a Program Level 1 because the worst-case scenario does not result in off-site impacts and there have been no accidental releases in the past five years that meet the RMP criteria.



V. Five Year Accident History

The Reno Distribution Center began operating in September 2012. Since operations began, there have been no accident related to the release of a regulated substance covered under the RMP regulations. The Reno Distribution Center has not previously stored large quantities of aerosol cans and this is the first RMP being submitted.



VI. Emergency Response Procedures:

PPG Reno Distribution Center coordinates emergency response activities with the local fire department. Additionally, the facility periodically reviews and trains employees on the written emergency response plant and evacuation procedures.



VII. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

Prevention programs utilized at the Reno Distribution Center include a fire prevention plan, aerosol storage operating procedure, equipment inspections, fire suppression system, inventory and storage controls and employee training as a result of a PHA completed under OSHA PSM regulations. These systems and safe guards are periodically assessed for effectiveness, at least every 5 years under OSHA PSM regulations.
